comment.text:
Very good high class Black owned. Good portions I ate my leftovers the next day. 
Server was very accommodating and gave good recommendations when I was indecisive.

Overall experience was "ehh". Kind of long post, FYI.

Had a reservation at 8, showed up at 8:05, but weren't sat until around 8:15... not a big deal.

Weren't greeted immediately bc my boyfriend & I had enough time to look over the menu & decide on everything we wanted before the server even came to greet us. 

Once the server arrived, we ordered everything at once (crab cakes, Caesar salad, chicken, steak, mashed potatoes & lobster Mac), then the server proceeded to say it was a good idea to order everything because they "cook everything homemade & the kitchen is also backed up"..... uhhhh ok? 

My boyfriend ordered a glass of wine as well, but he didn't get that until after our appetizers... around 9- mind you, we sat down at 815. Apps took about 35ish minutes to come out. Caesar salad & crab cakes were good & I was happy to see that the crab cakes were steaming hot so at least I know they weren't just sitting back there since it took a while for those to come out.

Dinner on the other hand didn't come out until around 935... again, we sat down at our table at 815. At this point, we were just laughing bc we saw another couple sit down & leave before they were even greeted by their server... that's how long service was taking. I asked my server what was the reason behind the extreme wait time & he went into this weird explanation that there was only one person per station, but anyone that's worked in a kitchen knows that that is pretty standard... they seemed short staffed all around. 

I did see Chef G Garvin walking around a little, but he wasn't greeting patrons tables as some have left reviews saying. I feel like he wasn't doing this because he knew that people were waiting extremely long.

Would I come back? Maybe if i was in the area & only immediately at opening time bc waiting over an hour for entrees is unacceptable anywhere you go. I was told this restaurant had only been open for 2 months so I hope they get the kitchen staff together or else... they're not going to last. Food was decent, but I wouldn't tell any family/friends to go bc of that atrocious wait time.
Food was delicious and service was great. Only gave 4 stars because we visited during a non peak time so I'm unsure of how the establishment manages peak crowds.

Amazing amazing amazing. I had the pleasure of going here again with a few of my friends and we had a wonderful time. The food is always on point and the service is next to none. I look forward to going here every time and I'm so glad that they are here to stay

Live in the area so wanted to give this closeby steakhouse a shot with my husband for our date night. Wasn't a fan of the steak I ordered neither was my husband. G. Garvin which had no idea was the owner was in that day and was very rude. Tried to say hello and he totally blew us off. Not sure why given the food isn't top tier. So many other great places to eat at in Atlanta. Would not go back or recommend.

Love this restaurant!! The food was absolutely delicious. I want to share information about parking since it is a bit confusing. If you drive down Spring Street, the garage will be on your left (before 10th Street). The restaurant validates if you self-park (no validation for valet). There wasn't a lot of spaces available for self-park... so you need to be prepared to valet. No cash needed for parking... cards are accepted!

My husband made reservations here for my birthday. I was excited to experience the cuisine of Chef G. Garvin.
Although we ABHOR going to Atl for anything, I gave in becuz  it's him.
We arrive, and you have to park in a deck and text a word to a code to pay for parking. So many dern steps..but, I didn't think anything of it cuz it's atl...
We arrive in the restaurant and the hostess doesn't say hi or anything. She yells "SHAWN!" I say, no, but how are u? Lol 
I tell her the name and they seat us immediately. 
A friend had previously been and told us a few things to try. 

So we're viewing the menu and know we want to start with lobster bisque, crab cakes and deviled eggs. Well, they were out of the bisque. I'm a bit confused, cuz our reservation was at 6 and they opened at 5 
Hell, idk how restaurants do in that regard, so, I was like ok whatever... 
I ordered the 12oz filet mignon, hubby got the 14oz bone in ribeye. Sides were whipped mash, green beans, and Mac n cheese. All seasoned VERY VERY WELL! We did order some creamed corn, which we heard was amazing. Waiter came back and said they were out 
Ok.......
For dessert, we ordered the doughnut bread pudding! So delish! I also had a bday cake that they charged $10 to cut 2 slices......... I know I know, I get there's a cutting fee......

I was a little disappointed that Chef Garvin didn't come speak. He walked around showing his face the entire time, but never spoke. ( we were 1 of 3 tables in the entire restaurant)... but I get it, gotta look important on a MONDAY! 


The food was top notch! WE WILL DEF BE BACK!

Really enjoyed my experience here at the Lowcountry steak I was told that Lowcountry met a southern  influence However I wish at least a couple of dishes would have been influenced by the Lowcountry experience which would save this restaurant apart from all the other steak houses in Atlanta very good concept and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. Our waitress Juliet was amazing love her would definitely come back to see her. And finally the bowl of starburst on the hostess stand great touch. Highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Brussel sprouts super sized on steroids so delicious

comment.text: I ordered a medium rare steak. When I told them the steak pictured (no filter) was not medium rare and was actually much more medium, the host/waiter told me there was nothing she could do and that it was definitely medium rare. She told me I'm required to pay for it. I told her I was not paying for it and that she can call the cops if she has to. She said well I don't prefer that course of action, as if she was actually going to call the cops.I told her I've had a many steaks, even at this restaurant and to please go get a second opinion. Finally, someone else came and agreed with me and offered another steak. The customer is definitely not a priority here. You be the judge!

photos.caption: Overcooked medium rare steak that the host was going to call the cops on me before giving me a new steak.
Overcooked medium rare- also shows center

comment.text: Wonderful service by the staff and the craft cocktails were really well made. The steaks were excellent and the desserts amazing!

Great customer service.  The manager, Chemere was so attentive and accommodating.  Julia, our waitress was adorable and was able to help us choose the best dessert and drinks.  We shared a 33oz steak, lobster Mac and brussel sprouts.  The drink was called a jack apple martini and it was yummy!  The peach cobbler was okay, but the bread budding was great.  Oh, they do validate parking.  Some reviews stated that they did not.

photos.caption: Lobster Mac, 33 oz and brussel sprouts.
Peach cobbler.  Top crust was amazing, but it was a little wet inside.

comment.text: I have had this restaurant on my list of places to visit, mainly because I have always loved G Garvin.  The res didn't disappoint. The spot is in a hidden location on 10th street.  The parking is around the corner in a parking building where you have to pay by a parking app. However, the restaurant will validate for 2 hours which was a pleasant surprise. Great menu with a number of dishes to choose from.  The crab cake appetizer is a must.   The drinks were all really good, a little pricey but not much over your normal steak house price.  The sea bass was a hit at the table.  They made a vegan version for someone in my party with tofu and she loved it.  I got the surf and turf.  It was very tasty, might have been a little overpriced but for a special occasion it happens sometimes.   Loved the spot and will be back for special occasions.
The food is excellent!  I ordered the trout and brussel sprouts. The ambiance is nice. I will definitely be visiting again.

What a great spot I know it says steak but the sea bass was amazing a sweet ponzu sauce wow creamed corn.  Yea please corn bread uh huh. Wonton where did that come from. Went in my belly fast.  Lobster Mac.  With a wife who's family fishes then in Maine. These  are legit.  Not to many tables so call ahead it'll be worth it!!

I came on here and read the reviews when they first opened and purposely waited to try this spot. I'm so glad i waited. They were experiencing problems because it was a new restaurant. They have great service and the food is good. You can find a better peach cobbler though. Also the family size sides could be a little bigger especially when the salmon is small.

This is a great new spot right in the heart of midtown. Service was great from the moment you walk in. We had a pretty large group but with our reservation we were seated right away. I don't eat red meat but my husband does but we felt there was a great amount of variety for both of us. We started with the tuna tartar, deviled eggs (I was able to remove the bacon), and the crab cakes. The tuna was great and fresh. I do with it was served with a version of a chip rather than bread but still great. The devil eggs were fantastic. I even loved the crab cakes and I typically hate crab of all kinds. But I was fresh and light so that made a difference. The chicken dish is EVERYTHING! It's served in a creamy sauce over mashed potatoes and it's is done perfectly. Like a flavor party in your mouth. My husbands steak was HUGE. He said it was great and even better the next day when he ate the leftovers. I finished with a peach cobbler. Not your typical peach cobbler because the crust Ken done with a puff pastry as the crust. Just the right amount of sweet. It was all so good, I went back again with a friend of mine and it was all great again. I didn't try anything different because I was craving what I had before but there are some items I'm definitely going back to try like the shrimp and grits. 
Great atmosphere, great service. Just go.

Absolutely one of the best dinner experiences I've had downtown. Atmosphere was beautiful. Service was superb. Owner comes by and speaks. Ohhh and the food is AMAZING. The steak melts in your mouth. The flavor in every dish is so delicious. How can fries taste this good??? Truffle fries...that's how. The lobster Mac and Cheese was mouth watering. I truly can't describe the food with justice. I would highly recommend dining here.

Severely Disappointed!!  The waitress Emma was great!  However, my steak was overcooked, the shrimp were cold and had zero garlic flavor, and the crab cakes were packed with filler.  G. Garvin, please fix your spot Bro

Not bad... in Atlanta for just one night and this place was down the street from my hotel.  Seemed like a decent option at 9:15 on a Monday night.  
I'd give the food a 4.5 overall. But the restaurant had a few goofy things going on that management should not allow.  Easy stuff to fix.  Example.... I ordered a chopped Caesar which was served straight out of the cooler in the same bowl.  No joke... the bowl practically had ice crystals on it.  So cold that had to order a hot tea to get myself back to room temp.  The tea comes out and the water is served in a large cream pourer (not sure what you call it).  Just odd. No pot?  My 12oz filet seemed a little soft when it came out but I'll tell you... they actually nailed it.  Right at the Medium Rare + that I asked for.  Really good job in the kitchen.  Broccoli was well cooked also. Thank you! Nothing worse than overcooked broccoli.   I admit I was craving a cheesecake and maybe it's a regional thing, but nada here.  All in all, I'd come again, but I'd skip the Caesar unfortunately.  It should be double the size and in room temp bowl.  Shout out to Donovan who took care of me at the bar.  The people working here are quality.   Just fix the operational pieces and you're a 5 star.   Thank you...

What can I say?  Let's just go with simple facts. Seven of us (4 adults and 3 tweens) popped in after a sporting event. The staff were all smiles and made us feel welcome and right at home instantly. To our surprise they seated us right away. The ambiance was exactly what you expect from a classy midtown restaurant--low light, cool vibe, and spotless.  The food?  Insane!  Impeccable ribeyes, succulent filet, and the best shrimp & grits these lifelong southerners have ever eaten!  The front of the house and back of the house have their acts together. Thank you thank you thank you. See you next time.

Absolutely wonderful! The food, the drinks, the atmosphere - ALL of it was amazing! For my drink, I had the whiskey collins (I think, lol). I wish I had a picture, but the drink was gone so quick, haha. Then I ordered the special for the evening. It was a blackened ribeye, on a bed of cheese grits, topped with lump crab. I mean, chef's kiss! I went with a group and we ordered a host of sides. Brussel sprouts, creamed corn, Parmesan fries, and mashed potatoes. I got a spoon (or two) of each and enjoyed every bite. I'd definitely recommend for a business dinner or date night. Plus, they validate parking (I think for 2hrs).

Nice ambience, but food was underwhelming. Started with the Sautéed Garlic Shrimp app. Very tasty, but be forewarned it's 6 medium shrimp for $16.  I had the bone out Ribeye, Filet, Green beans and Lobster Mac for entree. Green beans were cooked and seasoned perfectly. Lobster Mac was good, but certainly not the best. Steak was not well seasoned at all. The only flavor was the butter on top. Service was good, but our waitress hustled us out of $12 for water. I'll take the L on that for not being very specific about wanting tap water. I ordered a bottle of wine and got a different brand than what was on the menu. All said and done with 20% tip, the bill was $275. Definitely not worth it.
This place was absolutely delicious!! The mac n cheese w/lobster and the brussels sprouts were great! The drinks were strong and the service was good too!

First let me say that we watch G Garvins Cooking show on a regular basis, so for my upcoming birthday (which is today) we decided to go to Low Country Steak.  We reserved my table on Opendoor and advised that the special occasion was my birthday.   When we arrived we were welcomed with a warm greeting from the door to our table.  To start the server let us know she was going to be serving us but it would be a group effort, as she was in her last day of training. Ok, I was open to that, I wanted to make her feel comfortable, everyone has to start somewhere.  But soon after the greeting and giving us a few minutes to look over the menu, letting us know what the specials were...  service went down from there.  We ordered once we asked about a couple of things on the menu.  We are sitting there and hear the very personable server (Joshua) attending the table next to us thoroughly go over the specials and explain the dishes with such enthusiasm we heard a couple of other items we had no idea about. So I overheard his name and called him before he walked away and inquired about the seafood pasta and the calamari that wasn't offered to us.  My companion also overheard him explaining the steak selection to the table next to us which made him realize the ribeye we ordered may not have the bone which we prefer so he explained it and then proceeded to let us know that the restaurant was out of them. He was polite enough to ask if we wanted to change the order but assured us the boneless was just as flavorful so we kept it. Well when our server came back I mentioned that hey you didn't let us know about the seafood pasta or the calamari and she  was like oh sorry yes we have that. Ok. Then she took our wine glasses. Once again I heard Joshua explaining the wine and she said oh you didn't get a drink menu and we told her no, she brought one over  Besides that and bringing our water that was the last time she came back around. We saw the trainer a couple of times when she came back to see if we were satisfied with the temperature of the steaks  and everything but not much more. She seemed rush as she had a big party and a couple of other tables.  The last time I saw the training server she was bringing the check , which we hadn't asked for ,when I had to stop her and say hey do you have any desserts? It's my birthday, what do you have.  She simply said oh happy birthday, brought a menu, stated that all they do is put a candle on it and what would you like to order. Now I also explained this was our first time here and we hadn't been given a full run or details about the food and /or recommendations , if we wanted or needed anything else and wasn't really getting a full experience. She smiled and apologized that it was part her fault because the other young lady was training and she should have helped a little more. So my companion was talking to her about an item on the menu and trying to compare it to something and either she didn't realize he was still talking to her or didn't care and walked off!  Joshua came back over and we talked and we asked when he worked if we ever decided to come back.We learned more about the food and the menu from listening to him serve the people around us.  It speaks volumes that I remember Joshua who wasn't even our server and I can't tell you the names of the two ladies who were assigned to our table.  The food was good but the service was subpar.  When you go to a supposedly 5 star restaurant and pay those prices you should have a 5 star experience and customer service. That's why we choose these types of restaurants for a higher end experience. Food and Service.  I regret spending my birthday here.  Having good food alone won't keep customers coming back but a combination of good food and exceptional service will.  Please find more servers like Joshua. He was the only one who thanked us for coming and hoped we'd come back, ask for him and he would take care of us. If we ever decide to come back he would be the reason why. Disappointed at best.
The meat was not good the service was not good the atmosphere was OK the waiter did not understand proper preparation for stay and temperature

Decided to support a black business today.  The food was sub-par.  Out of ingredients for their speciality drinks.   Service and hostess were great.  Definitely not fine dining.   Came to the establishment based on the menu online.  Arrived at the restaurant and the menu was not the same.  Totally get menu changes but it also takes a few minutes to update your online menu.  chef G you have to do better.  Your celebrity will only get you so far.  Pay attention to the details if you are trying to do this for real.  Don't rely on your black card for a pass for sub-par food.  Wishing you all the best
Loved the steak and surprisingly the sides were equally delicious. Service was great. Highly recommend for a date night or special occasion.

I went here Saturday night with a college friend, and we were very pleased with the service of this restaurant. Very friendly and accommodating staff. The owner was there the night we went here, and he was also very pleasant. The food was delicious and cooked to perfection. I would definitely come back here. I throughly enjoyed myself!

For those with ADD, let me simply state that this is not a steakhouse. No way, no how!  If you want a great steakhouse experience intown, try Marcel or Kevin Rathbun Steak, where we typically go for great meat and the service you expect at a top notch steakhouse .  

First, the ambiance at Low Country feels like an upscale cafeteria, with very few booths and a lot of tables that feel like they were rented and arranged by an event company.  The space is generic, cavernous and simply doesn't have the scale, aesthetic and intimacy you expect when dropping $300.00 on a dinner. 

Now, on to the steak.  I ordered the aged Kansas City Strip and requested the temperature to be blue.  My daughter ordered the filet prepared rare.  Hers arrived medium and mine barely rare.  The quality of the meat was about what we get in the case at our local Kroger.  The Bearnaise and Hollandaise sauces were broken and roughly the consistency of egg drop soup.  To reiterate, this is not a steakhouse!

That said, the mussels app, salad, fried chicken and macaroni and cheese were good.  I think the Low Country needs to adjust the quality of food and experience to meet the hype and prices, or realistically value what they are offering if they expect to survive in a market with vastly superior options.

user.name: Gabrielle A.
user.address: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

comment.text: Ambience was amazing. We were warmly greeted by the owner of the restaurant. Steak was very flavorful and well seasoned. Our waiter was also very nice and even helped us locate local hot spots around town.

photos.caption: Mashed potatoes and rib eye steak

comment.text: I really liked the location and the ambiance of this restaurant. I'm happy that G put a lot of thought into creating a nice establishment. The parking garage adjacent to the building made things easy with transitioning back and forth to our car. I did think the food was pretty good. I found the outer crust to my steak to be a little charred though. I ordered it medium & I thought the lobster Mac and cheese was missing something. The highlight to me were the crab cakes and the calamari. If I were to go back, I'd probably just order drinks and appetizers. We spent over 300 and they really didn't do anything to celebrate birthdays. I was expecting a complementary birthday dessert and that was not offered. Overall good experience though.

The service was amazing and the food was really good! The lobster Mac and cheese didn't have any flavor . I loved my entree and all the sides were delicious.  The deviled eggs, Brussels sprouts, corn, and the whipped mash was my favorite! A great Place for GNO.

Restaurant was pretty empty, food came out cool or warm at best. Also ALL of our food was over salted. Steak was well done, not medium as requested and the staff were so unapologetic when we informed them of the issues. We were told that there was a no return policy so basically if the food isn't good, not their problem. So disappointing and we will not be returning. Would not recommend.
Exceptional! I had the Wonton Ravioli appetizer and Doughnut Bread Pudding for dessert and it was fabulous! Highly recommend!

Loved! Loved! Loved! This restaurant was absolutely AMAZING!!! I just randomly saw it driving down Peachtree and did my research and BABAY when I tell you I made the right decision! Didn't even realize it was G. Garvin's restaurant until I saw him hawking down my server for not having the place settings out. Way to go G for the quality control! Nonetheless she was absolutely incredible.The restaurant was very beautiful had a upscale vibe but also gave a little let your hair down after work. The deviled eggs did not disappoint and you could taste every pepper on that bacon. But who steals the show?? The CRAB CLAWS!!!! Omg! The blends of seasonings and herbs had me dancing at the table. Now for the entrees... can we say BOMB.com??? I got the blackened Ribeye with lump crab meat and my husband got the Ribeye that had a chimichurri spread over it. The steaks literally melt in your mouth. If you want to add sides I suggest the loaded potatoes and green beans just add a dabble of salt if you like a little extra kick to your veggies or if you don't have high blood pressure!

photos.caption: Bone In Ribeye | Loaded Mash | Green Beans

comment.text: Had dinner here today for the first time with another couple. The parking is tricky, park in the adjacent garage and the restaurant will validate up to 2 hours of your parking charges. The restaurant was fairly empty, we had reservations and requested an open booth however the hostess declined and said everyone had to be seated in one area of the restaurant. The food wasn't bad but also not memorable. There was nothing about the experience that would make me recommend or return. Again not horrible but there was no wow factor, no memorable dish, experience, etc. We spent about $280 including a tip for the 4 of us.

This is a new restaurant and they are off to a great start. COVID-19 protocol is in place so we felt safe. The service was great and the staff attentive. Both the appetizers and entrees were delicious! The owner was present and visited our table for a while. He was really hospitable. I really love the potato soup! We'll be back for sure.

Great food and the nicest people recommending dishes, drinks, etc. I cannot wait to come back here again and try other dishes. They rotate the menu seasonally FYI so the website is not as accurate. The shrimp scampi style dish is so good I had 3 of them (yes I did! and I'll do it again lol). The bar area is my favorite and I love that you can look into the kitchen and watch the magic happen.

Outstanding!  My husband got his Covid beard shaved off across the street, so we wandered into Low Country Steak for dinner. We were greeted by a very professional host staff who seated us immediately. Our server (shout out to Julia) was so kind, patient, and helpful. She was a big reason we enjoyed our evening so much. We ordered the deviled eggs and calamari for apps-both delicious. And for dinner I got the pasta/steak special and my husband ordered the shrimp and grits. Our main topic of conversation during dinner was how good our dinner was. Well done!  We-will-be-back!

This was a nice restaurant.. steak was good! Melted in your mouth.. but BAY BAYYYYYY what rakes the cake is the doughnut bread pudding!!!! My God!! Listen My God!! Lol we ordered one, then ordered another one! Please eat one!!

G Garvin has one of the best shrimp and grits I've ever tasted.  This dish, is well seasoned, very creamy with a perfect texture and consistency of the Grits.  The sauce added another layer of greatness.  Best thing on the menu.  The streak was also very delicious and come in at second.

I had the privilege of going here for dinner last night and it was amazing! Everything we had was superb... the cocktails, the crab cakes as an appetizer and the sea Bass was amazing! We also had dessert (the bread pudding & peach cobbler) both were amazing. Our server was great as well! I honestly can't wait to go back!
One of the best dining experiences I've had in years. Make sure you Try the Brussel sprouts! You won't be disappointed

Everything was absolutely  amazing! Our Server was very knowledgeable  about the menu and attentive. The music playing in the dinning room was not boring but relevant without been noisy and bothersome.  The food came out in a great amount of time. The crab cakes were ALL quality crab, the ribeye aged bone in  was everything the served said it would be and so much more, the Mac n cheese was the perfect creamy, the green beans has the perfect amount of seasoning with pieces of garlic garnished on top, and the truffle fries with house made ketchup did not disappoint. G Garvin walked the dinning  room greeting guests asking if their meals were made to their liking. He spoke with my table and friends for about 15 to 20 mins to welcome us and check on us. He was so friendly and welcoming. One of the steaks was not prepared medium as we requested but we did not complain but he noticed right away and took it off the bill as the kitchen was already closed so he could not have the prepare it again.  We will return to this axing restaurant. Everything was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of owner and chef upon entrance
Part of the dinning room across from the bar
Medium aged ribeye bone in cooked to perfection 18oz
Other side of the dinning room

comment.text: Had a wonderful experience tonight at Low Country Steak. The hosting staff was very attentive as soon as we walked into the restaurant.  As we waited for our table, she continued to advise it will be a moment. Which again speaks to the attentiveness. Once seated, the server advised of all the specials.  Enjoyed the atmosphere from the quickness of staff turning over tables to fresh white table linen. To providing drink in a moment. Seating was nicely spaced to adhere to Covid protocols.  Now the food was exceptional.  Thoroughly enjoyed our entire meal. From appetizer to main course. The presentation was on point. If In Atlanta,  please support this business.

My husband took me here for my bday. Service was superb the manager and our waitress Khristyn was awesome. I definitely recommend her. The food was delicious especially the steak with no long wait time. Location and parking was accessible.

Atlanta offers an endless list of places to dine, but LowCountry Steak should be on your list. We enjoyed our meal so much that we went back the next night. The restaurant is extremely well managed, the staff are very attentive and they all pitch in to help each other meet your every whim. But the food is the highlight of this place. Everything is seasoned perfectly and cooked exactly to order which can be challenging with steak. The snow crab claws, lump crab cocktail, filet and bone in rib eye were some of our favorites. The cocktails were perfectly crafted! And don't forget to leave room for the donut bread pudding!

The food was amazing and so was the service. The only problem was that no one at the hostess stand told me to validate my parking as soon as I walked in. They just sat me at a table and continued to talk to each other. The bartender ended up telling me and by that time it was too late. I had $60 meal for one and ended paying for the parking although it should've been validated. I also called a couple of weeks ago and asked the GM if I could pay in advance to have two cookbooks signed for friends. He took the information, but I have yet to hear from him. Great restaurant, but the professionalism from certain staff don't match the price-point of the establishment.

Sooooooooo. In town for the DST convention.  It has been hella hard to find somewhere to eat and for my Voting/Alternate delegates, the struggle is real.  So I open up my Facebook and see my Soror raving about this place and how G Garvin kept it open for the Deltas. Wow that's where I'm going to go and immediately tried to make a reservation for my chapter, around 20 people.  Imagine my distress when I try to use Open Table (the restaurant's suggestion) and can only reserve for 6. I had to use another profile to reserve for another 6.  12 seats still short of my 20 but with attrition and soirée we could make it work.  I tried to call the restaurant to confirm and explain but no one answered.  I went about my day doing the work of Delta, fully intending to show up at 8:30.  Unfortunately DST has other plans and our last session will convene at 7:30 ( thus was established at around 6:00/6:15). Ok. No problem.  I have other Sorors who can keep the date and I came come later. Then I get a call at 7 from the restaurant asking me if I knew I had 2 reservations or was it a mistake.  I told Karen that I had indeed made 2 res for 6. She replied with I should have called for a large party. I told her I did but got no answer.  She countered with we called you twice.  I lobbed with I was in session and could not answer the phone but I still intended to use the space but if I found I wouldn't need them I would call back at 7:30 (an hour before).  Lo and behold before 15 min was out Ranchhouse Becky had canceled my reservations. Pretty sure business tonight is going to be on the slow side because a lot of people have left ATL and the others are at the soirée. Not sure I want to patronize this business here nor his restaurant in LA. Thanks for narrowing an already slim selection.
One of the best filet mignon I have ever had. Service was friendly and world-class. There were 7 of us in our party and everyone loved their choices.
